name: Sirloin Gyros
description: There’s no need to overpay for restaurant gyros – you can easily make it right at home with a healthy homemade Greek yogurt tzatziki sauce!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
1 tablespoon olive oil (or more, to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine Greek yogurt, cucumber, garlic, vinegar, lemon juice, salt and pepper, to taste; drizzle with olive oil. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine Greek yogurt, cucumber, garlic, vinegar, lemon juice, salt and pepper, to taste; drizzle with olive oil. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine garlic, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons olive oil, yogurt, oregano, salt and pepper, to taste. Add sirloin, coating the beef completely; cover and place in the refrigerator for at least one hour.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine garlic, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons olive oil, yogurt, oregano, salt and pepper, to taste. Add sirloin, coating the beef completely; cover and place in the refrigerator for at least one hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a cast iron skillet over medium high heat. Add sirloin and cook, flipping once, until medium rare, about 4-5 minutes per side. Let the meat rest for 5-7 minutes before carving into thin slices.

recipeInstructions.text: To assemble, top each pita bread with sirloin, tzatziki sauce, tomatoes and red onion. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Delicious!! This recipe is definitely a keeper (as are all of your recipes). I'm excited to try it with chicken next time. I used Trader Joes tzaziki but will try my hand at it with your recipe next time. Thank you!!
